QuestionStem: The organisms below have some truly remarkable ways of reproducing.

images.caption: A sea star is an invertebrate that lives in the ocean. Sea stars reproduce sexually. They also reproduce asexually, by means of fragmentation and regeneration.
images.altText: This photograph shows a sea star. One leg is much shorter than the others; it appears to be regrowing through regeneration.

images.caption: A tapeworm is a parasitic invertebrate that lives in the intestines of many animals, especially vertebrates. Tapeworms reproduce sexually. They also reproduce asexually, by means of fragmentation and regeneration.
images.altText: This magnified image shows a tapeworm.

images.caption: A whiptail lizard is a reptile that lives in the southern United States and Mexico. Every whiptail lizard is a female. These lizards produce asexually, by means of parthenogenesis.
